label.text: Fast Fashion
Many people are concerned about the global environmental impacts of the manufacture and disposal of clothing.
Cotton fibres come from the outer layer of the cotton plant’s seeds. Compared to synthetic fibres, cotton fibres need less processing and biodegrade more easily.

The production of cotton textiles requires a lot of water, fertilisers, pesticides and other harmful chemicals. To try to solve these issues, sustainable cotton production methods are being developed.
For a crop to be certified as organic, it cannot be grown with synthetic fertilisers or pesticides. Geneticallly modified crops of cotton are also not classified as organic.
One researcher claimed that, ‘Organic cotton is sustainable. Non-organic cotton is not sustainable due to the amount of water it needs to grow’.
Which one of the following statements supports the researcher’s claim?
Genetically modified cotton crops use less water than non-genetically modified organic cotton crops.
Because natural fertilisers are used when growing organic cotton, the soil holds water for a longer time.
Cotton plants used in organic farming need the same amount of water as other organic crops.
Cotton uses a lot of water to grow.
Which of the following actions can be taken to reduce the negative environmental impacts of producing cotton textiles?
Select all correct answers.
Use water more efficiently.
Reduce the quality of the cotton textiles produced.
Increase the number of staff that cotton farms employ.
Use pesticides that are harmful only to the pest species being targeted.
Dispose of chemical waste in areas far away from the sites involved in cotton production.
Consider the three quotes, extracted from different sources. The sources argue that certified organic cotton should be used to reduce the negative environmental impacts of farming cotton.
Source identifier
Source
Quote
A
Website for an online shop selling organic cotton
‘Certified organic cotton production uses less water, energy and fuel. Its production also reduces the carbon footprint and the amount of chemical pollution released into the environment.’
B
Website article from a business journalist reporting on a non-profit conference
‘Because organic cotton is not genetically modified, more plants will be needed to get the same amount of cotton fibre. This means more land and water must be used to grow the organic cotton.’
C
Peer-reviewed article in an international agriculture journal

‘There was no significant difference found between the yields of organic and non-organic cotton in each year tested. In 2004, the organic cotton yield was 1459 kg/ha and in non-organic farms it was 1400 kg/ha.’

Which source is most trustworthy?
A B C
Why is the source you have selected more trustworthy than the others?
Select all correct answers.
It has been reviewed by other experts.
It compares the results of a scientific study over time.
There is a definition in the quote.
It is well written.
The author is an expert in analysing trends in data.
